Geospatial Addressing

  • How big an address space do we need?

    • Earthís radius is 6378 km
    • Earthís diameter is 40,075 km = 4.0075 x 109 cm
    • 232 = 4,294,967,296

  • 32 bits gives a resolution of .93 cm

  • in an Earth-centered frame of reference

    • 96 bits is enough
    • From the center of the earth to well beyond geosynchronous orbit
    • Easily fits into an IPv6 address (128 bits)
